text: Just catching up on these:

attachments.fallback: [January 17th, 2017 7:08 AM] arnaud: that's what you get for letting <@U0PB67X4K> pick the name :wink:
attachments.text: that's what you get for letting <@U0PB67X4K> pick the name :wink:

text: So in all fairness, it wasn’t Gari’s name suggestion.

We were talking back in the good ol’ `membersrvc` days about fabric-ca. There was a big issue on github where we talked about people misspelling the `membersrvcs`, or `memservices`, or `membersrvc`, etc...
The vote was between `fabric-ms` and `fabric-ca`, which is where we left it.
But I was too, wondering, for how long we’d have all these cops (instances ;-)) around us.
As an aside, we could only be so lucky that naming of all this stuff is our biggest issue (not just COP)  :wink:
Wait, then shall we go for `fabric-ms` ?!
[joking]
Hopefully Computer Associates won't complain. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0YK3KKCY>: as someone once said here: *we could only be so lucky…* :wink:
ca is quite commonly used for certificate authorities so we should be OK there (... we could only be so lucky)
Yes, I agree (and agreed to this back in the summer). It’s not as if we are going for fabic____ca_technologies_inc
Alright, back to work. So we need to work out a plan. I actually started yesterday.
I know that keith has been looking at these (the unit-tests, etc.) since morning.
We should plan a short “merge freeze” but since it’s only the fabric-cop repo that’s affected, it should not be impossible.
I've written about 10 lines of code since 9AM
ugh
I've pushed <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4129/> for the rename ... but after having to rebase, there is other cop name residue ... so a freeze would be good
trying to resolve the conflict now
<@U0UHG4VP1|ry> has joined the channel
Is it fatal if the fabric-cop repo, and the mirror on github, no longer exist under those names? do any other HYP projects rely on those exact paths existing?
<@U10LM0FFZ|nickgaski> has joined the channel
none that we know of  :wink:
<@U0UHG4VP1>, nope, that’s not a requirement (to be backward compatible/supporting repos that try cloning the code from the new “old” fabric-cop repo)
We have just started with the “docker’ work… so that’s fine to change it.
OK. I have asked what paths forward are open to me.
the one that causes us the least pain (hopefully you the least as well)
<@U3U0MV3PZ|kzhang> has joined the channel
KISS
Could I do this work tonight, when most people are asleep? there will be a short outage for gerrit, about 10 minutes
sounds reasonable... are you going to test beforehand?
yes, I'll import some other repo
cool
with open CRs?
sure, I will make one up.
I'm almost certain this is import->delete
<@U0UHG4VP1> Does this mean any work for <@U11HH3P7Y> with CI.   He was going to test <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4129/> in a sandbox soon I believe
there will be a little bit post-transition

one thing that won't be great is if we do the easy thing and rename the jobs in Jenkins, we'll lose all of the build history (links from gerrit to results will break), so it will be better to copy the jobs to the new names, then delete them in a week or two

<@U0S5KF44D> <@U11MANG9G>  -   <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-cop/blob/master/util/util.go#L211>   - do either of you have an issue with changing this to sha256?   Main reason is partial laziness on my part since the NodeSDK does not implement sha384 at this point.  I also think it's easier to find sha256 libraries for other languages as well

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric-cop
attachments.text: This is a read-only mirror of <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/admin/projects/fabric-cop> no pull requests accepted

text: Fine by me.
many thanks <@U0S5KF44D>  - you just saved me from what was sure to be a series of cut, paste, modify errors  :wink:
<@U0PB67X4K> : we might refactor that code to respond to hash algo that is being used at the client side.
so based on hashalgo , that is being used in client side , corresponding hash algo will be used on server side.
that can be done without BCCSP to start with , which can later be moved to BCCSP.
it should have nothing to do with the "client" side.  sure  - it could be a COP config setting if we wanted
but should not be determined by the client
I agree, it is more of server capability than client.

The server could support multiple client algorithms, right?  Not that we would have to, but it could have a configuration setting with currently enabled algorithms ... or just KISS and do as membersrvc did and have a single configured algorithm at a time
cfssl has the multiple signing profiles and the client specifies which profile to use ... just thinking that the algorithm could depend on that
hmm - so you the server would assume that the algorithm used to "sign" the auth token is the same as the one they are requesting to sign their cert?
interesting - might be confusing for people though
I think you make it configurable but use a fixed setting
that's the easiest way to avoid answering a million questions on why someone can't register or reenroll  :wink:

ok ... so how about using bccsp from the beginning to check auth header, and bccsp is configured as done in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3735/> ... where this configured bccsp instance is used for both auth header checking as well as for tcert key derivation
that was the original intent, is to have a single configuration stanza in the server's config as follows for this:

<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0S5KF44D> <@U11MANG9G> please take a look at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/q/project:lf-sandbox-2> . it is a copy of lf-sandbox. if you use a vgrep with <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/q/project:lf-sandbox> you'll see the differences
I think that would work <@U0S5KF44D>
I'm going to go get lunch, and if nobody objects I can move the timeline up to this evening instead of tonight.
I object  on principle
hehe
fine by me
<@U0UHG4VP1> sounds good to me

issues to be resolved: 1) do we delete the old project or mark it read only? 2) do we delete the github mirror or move it to the hyperledger-archive project or leave it? 3) what is the timeline for 1 - the question here is "how long do links from jenkins need to live on"?
is the only reason to keep it to look at historical build jobs?
and if anyone depends on those exact paths existing
I can't think of anyone who does at this point
I say delete it
or, I suppose, if there are any email threads pointing to changes
we are the only people who work / review COP
I'd suggest that we leave it for a week and delete if it doesn't hurt anything to leave it
s/ COP/project formerly known as&/
it doesn't hurt anything. On other projects we leave them as read only artifacts for years
for instance: look at all of the read-only projects here: <https://git.allseenalliance.org/gerrit/#/admin/projects/>
in _this case_, though, I'm a little worried about confusion going forward.
for active developers, you'll be able to add a new remote, delete the old one, and your repos live on (if you like)
in those cases for ASA, the code was subsumed by another project so the pre-merge code had value

yeh, that would be the case for deleting so there is no confusion ... as Gari said, only a few folks reviewing it, so should be safe to delete after a fixed amount of time.  We could be really generous and say 2 weeks and then delete IMO
I'll let you all tell me what you decide.
I don't want to change assumptions made by people on the east coast
smart man
it's up to <@U0S5KF44D>
well <@U0KM61BCP> and <@U11MANG9G> have also thrown in chips so I'll wait for them
<@U0MS3TK2A|nao> has joined the channel
Agree with <@U0S5KF44D> keep for week then delete
Hi, one of the areas we're trying to improve is usability/config.   Please see <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1720> and comment as we'd like to start on this soon
<@U0ZJZBJLF|yacovm> has joined the channel

You could do worse, Ry.....in fact I think this is why Bill Buckley once said "I'd rather be governed by the first 2000 people in the Boston telephone directory than by the 2000 people on the faculty of Harvard University".   

But first let's let Gari changed his name to Gari Aaaasingh.

I vote for #fabric-redsox for the new name.      :wink:

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2nf_bu-kBr4>

yes
